title: Atto Mensah
text:
Atto Ayippey Mensah (born 1964) is a Ghanaian-born Sierra Leonean <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach and former player. He lives in the <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a> and holds both Sierra Leonean and Dutch citizenship.
He came to Sierra Leone in 1980 and played for <a href="East%20End%20Lions">East End Lions</a> and won the championship in 1980 and 1985. Mensah gained Sierra Leonean citizenship in 1987.
Mensah made his international debut for Sierra Leone in the <a href="1988%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations%20qualification">1988 African Cup of Nations qualification</a> competition in a 2-0 victory over Nigeria in July 1987. He made 6 caps before moving to the Netherlands in 1989. There he had a trial at <a href="Sparta%20Rotterdam">Sparta Rotterdam</a> and played in the amateur ranks ending at ASV Arsenal. He got his UEFA B-licence in the Netherlands and worked as a youth coach. He is currently head coach of amateur-side ASV Arsenal in Amsterdam.
Mensah was appointed by the Ministry of Sport in September 2014, replacing the Northern Irish manager <a href="Johnny%20McKinstry">Johnny McKinstry</a> in the role of manager of the <a href="Sierra%20Leone%20national%20football%20team">Sierra Leone national football team</a> for the remaining <a href="2015%20Africa%20Cup%20of%20Nations%20qualification">2015 Africa Cup of Nations qualification</a> matches. He was replaced by <a href="John%20Ajina%20Sesay">John Ajina Sesay</a>, who was appointed by the <a href="Sierra%20Leone%20Football%20Association">Sierra Leone Football Association</a> in October 2014.
